title: Turkish troops 'begin crossing border into Syria' after US forces pull out

Turkey has sent troops across the border into northern Syria after US forces withdrew from the region, according to reports.

The soldiers aim to force US-backed Kurdish militants away from the border, according to a Turkish official.

A small forward group entered Syria early on Wednesday in preparation for a broader offensive, Bloomberg News reported.

Turkish officials have maintained that the border crossing is yet to begin, with preparations still underway.

US troops began withdrawing from the region following the directives of President Donald Trump.

The Kurdish forces in north Syria, who want their own state, helped the US in the fight against ISIS.

Trump's decision effectively provides Turkish troops with a green light to attack US-backed Kurdish forces, however Trump threatened to punish Turkey economically if it does "anything outside of what we think is humane."

(Image: Reuters)

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

Ankara regards the Kurdish People's Protection Units, also known as the YPG, as a terrorist group affiliated with the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK), which has fought the Turkish state for more than three decades.

But the US backs the YPG and credits the Kurds for helping defeat ISIS in Syria.

Ankara has said it intends to create a "safe zone" in order to return millions of refugees to Syrian soil, but the scheme

has alarmed some Western allies as much as the risks posed by the military operation itself.

President Tayyip Erdogan's communications director Fahrettin Altun said YPG fighters could either defect or Ankara would have to "stop them from disrupting" what he described as Turkey's struggle against Islamic State militants.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

"The Turkish military, together with the Free Syrian Army, will cross the Turkish-Syrian border shortly," Altun wrote in a tweet and in a column published in the Washington Post overnight.

"Turkey has no ambition in northeastern Syria except to neutralize a long-standing threat against Turkish citizens and

to liberate the local population from the yoke of armed thugs," he said.
description: US troops have begun withdrawing form the region which allows Turkish troops to attack Kurdish forces in north Syria
